summary: This is a Law360 news article discussing potential candidates to replace Audrey Strauss as the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) under the Biden administration. It mentions Strauss's high-profile cases, including those against Ghislaine Maxwell and Peter Nygard, and profiles three potential successors: Damian Williams, Katherine Goldstein, and Anjan Sahni.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Current U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, appointed in December, known for bringing high-profile cases including against Ghislaine Maxwell and Peter Nygard.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: President who is ramping up the process of choosing new top federal prosecutors, including potentially replacing Audrey Strauss at SDNY.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.role: Former President of the United States
persons.context: Former president whose appointed U.S. attorneys have been asked to step down by the Biden administration.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as a defendant in a high-profile sex-abuse case brought by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.

persons.name: Peter Nygard
persons.context: Mentioned as a defendant in a high-profile sex-abuse case brought by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.

persons.name: Bennett L. Gershman
persons.context: Quoted praising Audrey Strauss's stellar reputation inside and outside the office.

persons.name: Chuck Schumer
persons.context: Democratic Senator from New York who holds powerful sway over the SDNY U.S. Attorney application process.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.role: SDNY prosecutor, Securities and Commodities Fraud Task Force head
persons.context: Veteran SDNY prosecutor and potential successor to Audrey Strauss; prosecuted Sheldon Silver and Chris Collins; would be the first Black person to head the office.

persons.name: Sheldon Silver
persons.context: Former politician prosecuted by Damian Williams.

persons.name: Chris Collins
persons.context: Former politician prosecuted by Damian Williams.

persons.name: Merrick B. Garland
persons.role: D.C. Circuit Judge, Attorney General nominee
persons.context: Biden's nominee for Attorney General; Damian Williams was a former law clerk for him.

persons.name: Katherine Goldstein
persons.role: White collar partner at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP, former SDNY task force chief
persons.context: Potential successor to Audrey Strauss; would be the third woman to hold the SDNY U.S. Attorney position if confirmed.

persons.name: Mary Jo White
persons.context: Held the SDNY U.S. Attorney post from 1993 to 2002; mentioned as a precedent for female leadership.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.role: White collar partner at WilmerHale, former SDNY task force chief
persons.context: Potential successor to Audrey Strauss; noted for defense work in a forex-rigging trial.

persons.name: Rohan Ramchandani
persons.context: Citigroup trader acquitted in a forex-rigging trial where Anjan Sahni was part of the defense team.

persons.name: Preet Bharara
persons.context: Former SDNY U.S. Attorney fired by the Trump administration in 2017; said to have professional ties to the potential successors and a direct line to Chuck Schumer.

connections.description: Strauss brought sex-abuse charges against Maxwell as U.S. Attorney.
Strauss brought sex-abuse charges against Nygard as U.S. Attorney.
Williams was a former law clerk for Judge Merrick B. Garland.
Williams is said to be friendly with and have professional ties to former U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara.
Goldstein is said to be friendly with and have professional ties to former U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara.
Sahni is said to be friendly with and have professional ties to former U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara.
Bharara is said to have a direct line to Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer.
Sahni was part of the defense team that won acquittal for Citigroup trader Rohan Ramchandani.

events.title: Law360 Article on SDNY Succession
events.description: Law360 publishes an article discussing potential candidates to replace Audrey Strauss as U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York under the Biden administration.

events.title: Strauss Formally Appointed as U.S. Attorney
events.description: Audrey Strauss was formally appointed as U.S. Attorney for the SDNY by federal judges amid the outgoing Trump administration.

events.title: Merrick Garland Confirmation Hearing
events.description: Merrick B. Garland, Biden's nominee for Attorney General, is slated for a confirmation hearing in the Senate.

events.title: Preet Bharara Fired
events.description: Former Manhattan U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara was fired by the Trump administration.

keyFacts: Audrey Strauss, as U.S. Attorney for the SDNY, brought high-profile sex-abuse charges against Ghislaine Maxwell and Peter Nygard.
President Biden is in the process of choosing new top federal prosecutors and may replace Trump-appointed U.S. Attorneys, including potentially Audrey Strauss.

Three leading candidates to potentially succeed Strauss are identified: Damian Williams (who would be the first Black SDNY U.S. Attorney), Katherine Goldstein (who would be the third woman), and Anjan Sahni.
All three potential successors have professional ties to former SDNY U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara, who maintains a direct line to Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer.

The article highlights the influence of the "Garland clerk chain," suggesting a pre-existing relationship with Attorney General nominee Merrick Garland could be valuable for candidates like Damian Williams.
